intro: Ptilotus stirlingii subsp. stirlingii, commonly known as the Stirling's spinifex, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and dense, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and purple, which bloom during the cooler months. It is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and can tolerate extreme drought conditions. Its unique appearance and ecological resilience make it a notable species in its native habitat.
